results.title: Coal valley
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents the case for small scale private mining by examining the independence, ingenuity and engineering skill of the men who built and work five small privately owned coal mines on the west coast of New Zealand’s South Island. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Coal Power
results.brief_description: Includes “Power from the Valley”, outlining the process of brown coal mining in the La Trobe Valley and its eventual consumption in a turbine generator. (12 min) “Demolition of Yallourn Briquette Chimney” looks at the demolition of the historic briquette production plant at yallourn. Directed by Jim Hayes. (4 min) “The Timeless Force” is a history of the harnessing of energy and its eventual application by the SEC. Gives a history of the SEC’s early years. This film narrated by John Stanton. (29 min)

results.title: Coal mining today
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Information and New Realm
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film showing how Britain trains young miners in the skills necessary for operating new coal-mining machinery. Also details the uses of coal.

results.title: Coal from Westland
results.brief_description: Coal mining in the forest mountain of Westland, New Zealand. Shows miners at work in coal pits, at home with their families and enjoying leisure hours. The camera explores the rugged beauty of the mountains and deep gorges surrounding the mines.

results.title: Coal Dust the Invisible Killer
results.brief_description: High productivity at the coalface means increased dust, a major health hazard to the miner. Using diagrams and an actual lung a doctor explains how and what diseases are caused by prolonged exposure to coal dust, and answers key questions of concern to every miner. Strong emphasis is given to suppressing dust at source through effective ventilation and water sprays, combines with statutory monitoring of dust, regular X-Ray and medical examinations. Protection today prevents pneumoconiosis tomorrow.

results.title: Coal and the nineteenth century
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Dr. Colin Russell considers the use of coal as a raw material. The six sections of the film deal with different products resulting from the decomposition of coal, looking at both the manufacturing processes and the social impact. Wherever possibl

results.title: Coaching on the job (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This instructional video aims to help employees recognise when their staff have training needs and how to respond so that these training needs are met. Five steps are identified. Step one is to determine the need for coaching. This can be done by observation or be simply asking the employee what their training needs are. The second step is to explain the task or activity that needs doing. The third step is to demonstrate the activity in question. The fourth step is to practice the task. The fifth step is to ask for feedback. With re-enactments the video shows successful and not so successful methods of coaching with suggestions of how to amend each style.

results.title: Co-ops at work in Solomon Islands
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Describes the various co-operatives in the Solomon Islands. These are an important part of economic life and assist villagers in the production and distribution of timber, foodstuffs, copra and exports which are regulated by the Central Co-op Association in the capital Honiara.

results.title: Co-operative research in industry
results.brief_description: The film shows how small industrial firms in Britain band together to form Research Associations, thus enabling scientific research to be undertaken to help industry to produce more and better goods. The film illustrates the working of this system by examples of practical assistance of research results in the tanning, electrical, motor, laundry and printing industries.

results.title: Co-operative learning: from 'me' to 'we'
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Presents a classroom view of cooperative learning highlighting the key aspects of successful implementation. It is based on the experiences of four teachers showing cooperative learning at different stages of use in their classrooms.
